root.name: B.U.T.T.O.N. (Brutally Unfair Tactics Totally OK Now)
root.description: OverviewDeveloped by Copenhagen Game Collective and released on February 28th 2011 Brutally Unfair Tactics Totally OK Now was released as an Xbox Live Indie Game on Xbox Live Marketplace and PC. It supports 2-8 players. Brutally Unfair Tactics Totally OK Now was nominated as a finalist for a Nuovo Award at the 13th Annual Independent Games Festival in 2011 . GameplayIn Brutally Unfair Tactics Totally OK Now the objective is to reach your button first. The button is located on the Xbox 360 Controller or the keyboard for the PC version. It is possible for 4 players to play using one controller or 8 people if they use 2 controllers. The game will display various rules for each round but not actually keep track of whether the players obey these rule or not. This is not looked at as a shortcoming, but as a feature as it is up to the players to decide whether to play by the rules or not. The game has many different rules eg: slow-motion, pose like a ninja, jump up and down like a monkey and many more. Different VersionsBrutally Unfair Tactics Totally OK Now currently comes in 3 different version. The Xbox 360 VersionThe Xbox 360 version is considered an older version of the game, though the developers have said it might get updated in the future. It features an optional Adult/Naughty Mode. Steam VersionThe Steam version of Brutally Unfair Tactics Totally OK Now features Steam Achievements. This version, however, does not include the Adult/Naughty mode. Non-Steam PC VersionThe non-Steam PC version of Brutally Unfair Tactics Totally OK Now has no achievements, however it does include the Adult/Naughty mode. Soundtrack The soundtrack for Brutally Unfair Tactics Totally OK Now was composed by Nicklas "Nifflas" Nygren and features 11 tracks. Track listing 01. Brutally Unfair Tactics02.
